Interface BlockInterface

All Superinterfaces:
be.uliege.montefiore.oop.audio.Filter
All Known Implementing Classes:
Block
public interface BlockInterface
extends be.uliege.montefiore.oop.audio.Filter
Interface of a Block which is an extension of the Filter interface.
Author:
Maxime GOFFART (180521) and Olivier JORIS (182113).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Block getInput​(int inputNumber)
    Returns the Block connected to the input inputNumber.

  • Method Details

    • getMainFilter

      be.uliege.montefiore.oop.audio.Filter getMainFilter()
      Returns the main filter of the Block.
      Returns:
      The main Filter of the Block.

    • getInput

      Block getInput​(int inputNumber) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the Block connected to the input inputNumber.
      Parameters:
      inputNumber - The index of the considered input.
      Returns:
      The Block linked to the input inputNumber.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - inputNumber is out of bounds.

    • getOutput

      Block getOutput​(int outputNumber, int index) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the outputNumber-th output of the Block.
      Parameters:
      outputNumber - The index of the considered output.
      index - The index inside the output outputNumber.
      Returns:
      The Block linked to the output outputNumber index.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - outputNumber is out of bounds.
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - index is out of bounds.

    • getInputAvailability

      boolean getInputAvailability​(int inputNumber) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Gets the availability status of the input inputNumber.
      Parameters:
      inputNumber - The index of the considered input.
      Returns:
      True if the input inputNumber is available. Else, false.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - inputNumber is out of bounds.

    • setInput

      void setInput​(Block f, int inputNumber) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Sets the input inputNumber as f.
      Parameters:
      f - The Block to which we want to make a connection.
      inputNumber - The index of the considered input.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - f is null.
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - inputNumber is out of bounds.

    • setOutput

      void setOutput​(Block f, int outputNumber) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Sets the output outputNumber as f.
      Parameters:
      f - The Block to which we want to make a connection.
      outputNumber - The index of the considered output.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - f is null.
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - outputNumber is out of bounds.

    • setInputAvailability

      void setInputAvailability​(int inputNumber, boolean status) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Sets the input inputNumber availability status as status.
      Parameters:
      inputNumber - The index of the considered input.
      status - The new status.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - inputNumber is out of bounds.
